version_description:
AnyList v5.4.1 is a minor bug fix update.

If you enjoy AnyList, please consider writing a review on the App Store. Positive reviews improve our ranking and help new users learn about the app, so we greatly appreciate them.

Note that we cannot respond to reviews on the App Store, so if you have feedback or a question that requires a response, email us at team@anylistapp.com and we'll get back to you.

----

AnyList v5.4:

- New recipe fields for star rating, servings, prep & cook time, and nutrition info.
- Recipe collections can be sorted by name, rating, and date created.

----

AnyList v5.3.1:

- Minor bug fixes.

----

AnyList v5.3:

- The list name and number of items remaining is now visible at the top of the list screen.
- It's now possible to show and hide completed items directly from the list screen, without having to go into a menu.

----

AnyList v5.2.1:

- Improved the Account Info screen.

----

AnyList v5.2:

- Added the ability to search the web for photos to use with your list items and recipes. (Requires AnyList Complete.)

----

AnyList v5.1.1:

- Added a 'double tap to cross off option to help prevent accidentally crossing off an item with an errant tap.

----

AnyList v5.1:

- The classic AnyList behavior for crossing off items has been restored. Just tap the item to cross it off.
- The pencil icon to cross off items was a bad idea. Pencil icons usually mean 'edit'. In this update, tap the pencil icon to edit the item.
- Tapping on an autocomplete suggestion now adds it directly to the list, just like it used to. If you want to edit item details before adding the item, tap the pencil icon next to the autocomplete suggestion.
- The big header at the top of the list with the list name has been removed. You can show and hide completed items in the More Actions (...) menu, which means that is now accessible even if you have scrolled down in your list.
- There is a new setting on the Stores screen to turn off store names in your list if you don't want to see them. Store names are now shown below the item notes, too.

----

AnyList v5.0:

- Quickly edit items. Tap on the pencil icon next to an item to bring up the new quick item details screen, and add a note or photo, change the item's category, assign stores, and more.
- Edit multiple items at once. You can now modify items (add to favorites, assign stores, etc.) in bulk.
- Edit new item details. When adding an item to your list, you can now edit the item's details (category, stores, note, etc.) as you add it to your list, by tapping the pencil icon text to it.
- Shake to undo. If you accidentally cross off or delete an item, shake your device to undo.

AnyList v5.5 includes the brand new AnyList for Apple Watch! Now you can quickly view your lists and cross off items right from your wrist. AnyList for Apple Watch includes a complication that can be added to your watch face so that your lists are always just a tap away.

AnyList for Apple Watch is available exclusively to AnyList Complete subscribers. AnyList Complete is an optional subscription that unlocks the full power of AnyList and helps to support our development efforts.

If you enjoy AnyList, please consider writing a review on the App Store. Positive reviews improve our ranking and help new users learn about the app, so we greatly appreciate them.

Note that we cannot respond to reviews on the App Store, so if you have feedback or a question that requires a response, email us at team@anylistapp.com and we'll get back to you.

----

AnyList v5.4.1:

- Minor bug fixes.

----

AnyList v5.4:

- New recipe fields for star rating, servings, prep & cook time, and nutrition info.
- Recipe collections can be sorted by name, rating, and date created.

----

AnyList v5.3.1:

- Minor bug fixes.

----

AnyList v5.3:

- The list name and number of items remaining is now visible at the top of the list screen.
- It's now possible to show and hide completed items directly from the list screen, without having to go into a menu.

----

AnyList v5.2.1:

- Improved the Account Info screen.

----

AnyList v5.2:

- Added the ability to search the web for photos to use with your list items and recipes. (Requires AnyList Complete.)

----

- Added a 'double tap to cross off option to help prevent accidentally crossing off an item with an errant tap.

AnyList v5.5.3 introduces the ability to add items to lists via the Apple Watch app, as well as filter lists in the Apple Watch app. Also, when using our iOS extension to import recipes, you can now choose recipe collections for the new recipe.

If you enjoy AnyList, please consider writing a review on the App Store. Positive reviews improve our ranking and help new users learn about the app, so we greatly appreciate them.

Note that we cannot respond to reviews on the App Store, so if you have feedback or a question that requires a response, email us at team@anylistapp.com and we'll get back to you.

- AnyList for Apple Watch is available exclusively to AnyList Complete subscribers. AnyList Complete is an optional subscription that unlocks the full power of AnyList and helps to support our development efforts.

AnyList v5.6 introduces the ability to easily add quantities & prices to list items. By entering prices, you can stick to your budget by seeing a running total for your list. Futhermore, you can enter prices for multiple stores to help compare prices and figure out where you can save money.

Entering item quantities is part of the basic, free functionality of AnyList. Entering item prices requires AnyList Complete, our optional paid subscription that unlocks the full power of AnyList and helps to support our development efforts.

If you enjoy AnyList, please consider writing a review on the App Store. Positive reviews improve our ranking and help new users learn about the app, so we greatly appreciate them.

Note that we cannot respond to reviews on the App Store, so if you have feedback or a question that requires a response, email us at team@anylistapp.com and we'll get back to you.

AnyList v5.6.1 fixes a few bugs when entering item quantities & prices, including a problem when entering some prices in locales that use a comma as the decimal separator.

AnyList v5.6.2 introduces settings to control what's shown in the running total bar. If you'd prefer to see the cost of the remaining items, rather than the cost of the crossed off items, you can now make that change. A few miscellaneous minor bugs with entering quantities & prices have also been fixed.

AnyList v5.7 introduces the ability to sync your Amazon Alexa shopping and to-do lists with AnyList. Items added via Alexa will show up in AnyList instantly, and any changes made in AnyList will be reflected by Alexa.

To get started, open the Amazon Alexa app, install the AnyList skill, and link it to your AnyList account. Once you've done that, the Lists screen in AnyList will include two new lists named "Alexa Shopping List" and "Alexa To-do List". Then you can use your Amazon Echo to add items to those lists. For example, if you say "Alexa, add apples to my shopping list", then "Apples" will appear in the "Alexa Shopping List" in AnyList within a few moments.

For more detailed setup instructions, open AnyList, go to the Settings tab, scroll down, and choose Amazon Alexa Sync. And as always, you can contact team@anylistapp.com with any questions or feedback.

If you enjoy AnyList, please consider writing a review on the App Store. Positive reviews improve our ranking and help new users learn about the app, so we greatly appreciate them.

AnyList v5.7.1 adds the ability to sync all of your lists with Amazon Alexa. Currently only Alexa devices in the United States support syncing of all your lists. In other regions, only your built-in Alexa shopping and to-do lists will be synced.

Items added via Alexa will show up in AnyList instantly, and any changes made in AnyList will be reflected by Alexa.

To get started, open the Amazon Alexa app, install the AnyList skill, and link it to your AnyList account. Once you've done that, the Lists screen in AnyList will include two new lists named "Alexa Shopping List" and "Alexa To-do List". Then you can use your Amazon Echo to add items to those lists. For example, if you say "Alexa, add apples to my shopping list", then "Apples" will appear in the "Alexa Shopping List" in AnyList within a few moments.

For more detailed setup instructions, open AnyList, go to the Settings tab, scroll down, and choose Amazon Alexa Sync. And as always, you can contact team@anylistapp.com with any questions or feedback.

AnyList v5.8.2 includes changes to support the switch to our new domain, anylist.com.

If you enjoy AnyList, please consider writing a review on the App Store. Positive reviews improve our ranking and help new users learn about the app, so we greatly appreciate them.

AnyList v5.9.5 fixes a crash on launch that could occur with AnyList v5.9.4. We're sorry for the trouble that was caused by this bug and will examine our internal processes to attempt to prevent future problems of this nature.

Also, the Recipe Web Browser functionality has been changed. Instead of having a web browser embedded in the AnyList app, you are now taken to Safari, where you can use our Recipe Import action to import recipes from recipe websites and blogs.

Thank you for using AnyList. If you have any questions or suggestions for improving the app, please get in touch with us at team@anylist.com.

AnyList v5.10 adds the ability to send a recipe via email or AirDrop to other people who also use AnyList. In the case of email, a file is attached to the email that can be tapped to import the recipe into AnyList. In the case of AirDrop, the other person will see a prompt on their device to import the recipe.

AnyList v5.10 also adds a new list setting to control the position of newly added items. Previously they were always added at the bottom, now they can optionally be added at the top. To change this, open List Settings, then go to the "Insert New Items" setting.

AnyList v5.10 also adds the ability to filter favorite items by store.

AnyList v5.10.1 includes minor bug fixes.

If you have any questions or suggestions, please contact us at team@anylist.com. Thanks for using AnyList!

AnyList v5.9.3 includes a number of bug fixes.

AnyList v5.9 introduces a number of major changes to categories. Categories are now maintained on a per-list basis, which means categories in shared lists will stay in sync for all users of the list. In addition, renaming a category in one of your lists won't impact the categories in your other lists.
Since users of a shared may have previously had different categories for a shared list, after updating to AnyList v5.9 you may see categories in your shared lists appear in a different order than before and / or items in shared lists may appear in different categories than in previous versions of AnyList. Please see the FAQ here for more information:

https://help.anylist.com/articles/release-notes-anylist-v5-9/#per-list-categories-faq

============

AnyList v5.9 introduces the ability to duplicate a list.

https://help.anylist.com/articles/duplicate-list/

============

AnyList v5.9 includes complications for the new Apple Watch Series 4 watch faces.

============

AnyList v5.9 improves support for the iPhone XS Max and new iPad Pros.

============

Full release notes can be viewed here:

https://help.anylist.com/articles/release-notes-anylist-v5-9/

Thank you for using AnyList and if you have any questions or suggestions for improving the app, please get in touch with us at team@anylistapp.com.

AnyList v5.8.3 fixes a few minor bugs and glitches.

AnyList v5.8 added support for SiriKit, which allows items to be added directly to AnyList via Siri.

If you enjoy AnyList, please consider writing a review on the App Store. Positive reviews improve our ranking and help new users learn about the app, so we greatly appreciate them.

AnyList v5.9 introduces a number of major changes to categories. Categories are now maintained on a per-list basis, which means categories in shared lists will stay in sync for all users of the list. In addition, renaming a category in one of your lists won't impact the categories in your other lists.

Since users of a shared may have previously had different categories for a shared list, after updating to AnyList v5.9 you may see categories in your shared lists appear in a different order than before and / or items in shared lists may appear in different categories than in previous versions of AnyList. Please see the FAQ here for more information:

https://help.anylist.com/articles/release-notes-anylist-v5-9/#per-list-categories-faq

============

AnyList v5.9 introduces the ability to duplicate a list.

https://help.anylist.com/articles/duplicate-list/

============

AnyList v5.9 includes complications for the new Apple Watch Series 4 watch faces.

============

AnyList v5.9 improves support for the iPhone XS Max and new iPad Pros.

============

Full release notes can be viewed here:

https://help.anylist.com/articles/release-notes-anylist-v5-9/

Thank you for using AnyList and if you have any questions or suggestions for improving the app, please get in touch with us at team@anylistapp.com.

AnyList v5.9.4 fixes a few minor bugs related to accessibility text sizes and recipe sharing.

Thank you for using AnyList. If you have any questions or suggestions for improving the app, please get in touch with us at team@anylist.com.

AnyList v5.9.5 fixes a crash on launch that could occur with AnyList v5.9.4. We're sorry for the trouble that was caused by this bug and will examine our internal processes to attempt to prevent future problems of this nature.

Also, the Recipe Web Browser functionality has been changed. Instead of having a web browser embedded in the AnyList app, you are now taken to Safari, where you can use our Recipe Import action to import recipes from recipe websites and blogs.

Thank you for using AnyList. If you have any questions or suggestions for improving the app, please get in touch with us at team@anylist.com.

AnyList v5.10 adds the ability to send a recipe via email or AirDrop to other people who also use AnyList. In the case of email, a file is attached to the email that can be tapped to import the recipe into AnyList. In the case of AirDrop, the other person will see a prompt on their device to import the recipe.

AnyList v5.10 also adds a new list setting to control the position of newly added items. Previously they were always added at the bottom, now they can optionally be added at the top. To change this, open List Settings, then go to the "Insert New Items" setting.

AnyList v5.10 also adds the ability to filter favorite items by store.

If you have any questions or suggestions, please contact us at team@anylist.com. Thanks for using AnyList!

AnyList v5.12 adds support for conversational Siri shortcuts on iOS 13.1. Now you can easily create a Siri shortcut that will allow you to add an item directly to a given list via voice.

Other notable changes:

- Updated Apple Watch complication icons for some watch faces.
- Improved the look of crossed off items in Dark Mode.
- Fixed a bug where location-based reminders could be incorrectly displayed.

Thank you for using AnyList and as always, if you have any questions or suggestions for improving the app, please get in touch with us at team@anylist.com.

AnyList now supports the Google Assistant!

To get started, make sure you have the Google Assistant app installed, then go to the Settings tab in AnyList and select Google Assistant under the Voice Assistants section to link AnyList with your Google Assistant.

Once your account is linked, you can use your Google Assistant to add items to lists, create new lists, and ask about the contents of your lists. For example, to quickly add items to a list, just say, "Hey Google, add apples to my grocery list" or "Hey Google, add sunscreen to my packing list."

Thank you for using AnyList and as always, if you have any questions or suggestions for improving the app, please get in touch with us at team@anylist.com.

AnyList now supports the Google Assistant!

To get started, make sure you have the Google Assistant app installed, then go to the Settings tab in AnyList and select Google Assistant under the Voice Assistants section to link AnyList with your Google Assistant.

Once your account is linked, you can use your Google Assistant to add items to lists, create new lists, and ask about the contents of your lists. For example, to quickly add items to a list, just say, "Hey Google, add apples to my grocery list" or "Hey Google, add sunscreen to my packing list."

AnyList v5.14 is a major update containing several highly requested features.

• Similar recipe ingredients are now automatically combined into a single list item which shows the total quantity needed.
• Details from matching favorite & recent items are also automatically applied to ingredients in your list.
• A new Item Details screen allows you to quickly view and edit all list item properties, including the new Package Size field.
• The Quantity field now supports arbitrary units and a custom keyboard makes it easy to enter common units, including oz, lb, and gallons.

Learn more about these and other improvements by going to the Settings tab in AnyList and tapping on What's New.

Thank you for using AnyList and as always, if you have any questions or suggestions for improving the app, please get in touch with us at team@anylist.com.

AnyList v5.15 adds the ability to move and reorder entries in the meal planning calendar via drag & drop. Just press and hold on a recipe or note and drag it to the desired date. In bulk edit mode, you can select multiple entries and then drag all of them at once

This update also adds the ability to drag & drop lists into a folder.

AnyList v5.16 includes a new full screen recipe view that allows you to mark off ingredients as you use them, highlight the current preparation step, and quickly add recipe notes while you're cooking.

When cooking multiple recipes, you can use the full screen recipe view's recipe switcher to quickly jump between different recipes.

AnyList v5.17 introduces support for widgets, so you can quickly access your lists and meal plan right from your home screen.

• Use the List widget to keep track of what's on a list, without needing to open the app.
• Keep frequently used lists just a tap away with the Multiple Lists widget.
• Take a quick glance at the Meal Plan widget to see what's for dinner tonight.

Thank you for using AnyList and if you have any questions or suggestions for improving the app, please get in touch with us at team@anylist.com.
